author.name: William Shakespeare
author.biography: English playwright and poet, widely regarded as the greatest writer in the English language.

author.name: Jane Austen
author.biography: English novelist known for works such as Pride and Prejudice, which critique the British landed gentry.

author.name: Charles Dickens
author.biography: English writer and social critic, known for creating some of the world's best-known fictional characters.

author.name: Mark Twain
author.biography: American writer, humorist, and entrepreneur, best known for The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn.

author.name: Leo Tolstoy
author.biography: Russian author known for his novels War and Peace and Anna Karenina, which are regarded as literary masterpieces.

author.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
author.biography: Russian novelist and philosopher, noted for Crime and Punishment and The Brothers Karamazov.

book.title: The Old Man and the Sea

author.name: Ernest Hemingway
author.biography: American journalist, novelist, and short-story writer known for The Old Man and the Sea and A Farewell to Arms.

author.name: Virginia Woolf
author.biography: English writer and modernist known for novels like Mrs Dalloway and To the Lighthouse.

author.name: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
author.biography: Colombian novelist known for works of magical realism, including One Hundred Years of Solitude.

author.name: Franz Kafka
author.biography: Czech writer known for surreal and existential works like The Trial and The Metamorphosis.

author.name: George Orwell
author.biography: English novelist and essayist, best known for his novels 1984 and Animal Farm.

author.name: Homer
author.biography: Ancient Greek poet traditionally said to be the author of the epic poems the Iliad and the Odyssey.

author.name: Herman Melville
author.biography: American novelist, short story writer, and poet best known for Moby-Dick.

author.name: Emily Bronte
author.biography: English novelist and poet, known for her only novel, Wuthering Heights.

author.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
author.biography: English writer, poet, philologist, and author of The Lord of the Rings.
